instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message: Got a customer come in with broken screen.  Replaced the screen but now it doesn't charge, but said he was having issues with charging anyway.  I replaced the magsafe and have only gotten orange light for about 30 seconds before it fades out.  I took out the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a logic board and noticed a few burned out filters.  I tried re-flowing them but looks like they need to be replaced.  I couldn't find a schematic for the logic board with a google search so was hoping you could point me to the right direction to get a replacement.  Do these two filters have anything to do with charging?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message:
From left to right....

<RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR> pull up resistor for battery data line SDA. Value: 2K
<RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> pull up resistor for battery data line SCL. Value: 2K
<RESISTOR>R5187</RESISTOR> pull up resistor for <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>. Value 100K

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR> - 1.98
<RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> - 1.974
<RESISTOR>R5187</RESISTOR> - 10.33

Do any of them need to be replaced?  Where can I start to find out why the computer is not charging and orange light stays on for 20 seconds.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message: Is <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> still high after the green/orange light goes out? Looks like it had liquid damage at some point.
